name: Universal Life Benefits
content: Understanding the advantages of Universal Policies

steps.name: Payment Flexibility
steps.content: Universal life policies allow flexible adjustments to payment size and frequency, offering financial adaptability.

steps.name: Death Benefit
steps.content: Universal policies may enable increasing the death benefit with a medical exam, providing flexibility for changing coverage needs. Decreasing the death benefit is typically an option after a few years, allowing policyholders to adjust coverage over time.

steps.name: Interest on Cash Value
steps.content: The cash value account associated with your policy earns interest at a rate set by your insurer. This rate is subject to frequent changes, which can impact the growth of your cash value over time.

choices.content: A policy that offers fixed premium payments and death benefit.
A type of life insurance policy that offers flexibility in premium payments, death benefit, and cash value.
A policy that only provides cash value without any death benefit.
A policy that offers a fixed death benefit but flexible premium payments.
